#  b00tl3gRSA2

## Objetivo
In RSA d is a lot bigger than e, why don't we use d to encrypt instead of e? Connect with `nc jupiter.challenges.picoctf.org 19566`.

## Solución
```python
┌──(emgeek㉿EmGeek-Kali-PC)-[~/Documents/pruebasHacking]  
└─$ python3  
Python 3.11.6 (main, Oct  8 2023, 05:06:43) [GCC 13.2.0] on linux  
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.  
>>> c = 3134766953267224941505810242781058858813938612205833224347022016250773887  
994105142327276767491091683474819699671335077914836751567661564000857625770773755  
189526318858049673332663577836209404131947667032047064285506938097655413987473120  
7631182778344149694454227227532974271598286390837484438274379557482016172  
>>> n = 1209519725720270808835873879997091712975299713418036192116149109066410750  
425976700447556720885641396150674282323350971829410292018163784380592693832213325  
598405733341307357438668491992926687096076094218687709120731324506670302957753776  
63007159766110570669528586976720808402517495262331219281259529634080401529  
>>> d = 1202063693720164160579626370231328479198318449640004139663108471868143665  
524743891698593342713955186466909807140498021700184331751820525322507040715527877  
712126079363087559062630600060879773112896269266151991757453383082878047706258639  
20275637420091161608837493164824306653952266830642900772021718213738447573  
>>> e = 65537  
>>> m = pow(c,d,n)  
>>> m  
637474089232156899029399138756065171446141896669737618380178087992758347781875330  
303552502240799535300164452406507675964243798662285721698524801842577909586723447  
047396732108526335656036814082289954168887147892501393769357804973889262650442903  
48105679613343867337992415764291775470719776227971996032189837629  
>>> from Crypto.Util.number import long_to_bytes  
>>> long_to_bytes(m)  
b'Z\xc7\x81\xc0\x8fl]M*^\x90\x8b\xd6\x81\xef$A\x80\x9dx>\xc1\x9a\xf87\x9a\xf2\xd6  
\xc8\xecc.\x83\x89\x87w\xb3\xcdY\x96\xbfV\x8d\x04}\xac\'\xdd\xc9\xa7\x05uL\xce#\x  
f2gb\x9b\xea\x8dM\x8c\xbb\x1a@\x8a\xfe\xb1U\x15+\x11\x86\xa9\xfb\x98>\xb2M\x11\xa  
b\xc4"\x020\x8d>oC\x92g\xaa:L\xd2:"\xaef\xe1\xc5\xebeZ!\xd7\xc5\x91R\x99\xf9\xcf\  
x8eM\x06\xdbl\x0f%e\x92\xc3T\xefo\xb1='  
>>> m = pow(c,e,n)  
>>> long_to_bytes(m)  
b'picoCTF{bad_1d3a5_2438125}'
```
